intro: Gnidia poggei, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow or red center. Its leaves are typically broad and palmately lobed, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Gnidia poggei is often found in rocky outcrops and is adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its natural habitat.
